Detailed Description

The class will receive Demand sent by sendBroadcast().

If you want to receive Demand sent by sendBroadcast(), you can register a Subscriber to system. Then you can receive Demand which you want from sendBroadcast() and the onReceive() in Subscriber will be called.

Before register a Subscriber, we need to add Action to DemandFilter and implement onReceive() function.

The follow example demonstrates how to set and register Subscriber class.

 class MySubscriber : public Subscriber {
   public:
      virtual void onReceive(Context* context, const Demand& demand);
 };

 void MySubscriber::onReceive(Context* context, const Demand& demand) {
   if(demand.getAction().compare("EVENT1") == 0) {
      demand.getIntExtra(String("key1"), 1);
   } else if(demand.getAction().compare("EVENT2") == 0) {
      demand.getStringExtra(String("key2"));
   }
 }

 class MyPage : public Page {
   public:
      MySubscriber* mpSubscriber;
 };

 void MyPage::onStart() {
   DemandFilter filter;
   filter.addAction("EVENT1");
   filter.addAction("EVENT2");

   mpSubscriber = new MySubscriber();
   Context(this).registerSubscriber(*mpSubscriber, filter);
 }

 void myPage::onStop() {
   Context(this).unregisterSubscriber(*mpSubscriber);
 }

Sets the flag indicating that this subscriber should abort the current broadcas.

int32_t gaia::core::Subscriber::getResultCode ( ) const

Retrieve the current result code.

gaia::base::String* gaia::core::Subscriber::getResultDataN ( ) const

Retrieve the current result data, as set by the previous subscriber.

Often this is NULL.

Persistence* gaia::core::Subscriber::getResultExtrasN ( ) const

Retrieve the current result extra data, as set by the previous subscriber.

Any changes you make to the returned Map will be propagated to the next subscriber.

bool gaia::core::Subscriber::isOrderedBroadcast ( ) const

Returns true if the subscriber is currently processing an ordered broadcast.

virtual void gaia::core::Subscriber::onReceive ( Context *  context,
const Demand &  demand 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called when the Subscriber is receiving Demand that you want.

Parameters:
contextThe Context in which the receiver is running.
demandThe Demand being received.

Implemented in gaia::admin::DeviceAdminReceiver, and gaia::core::AppWidgetProvider.

Subscriber& gaia::core::Subscriber::operator= ( const Subscriber &  o) [private]
void gaia::core::Subscriber::setResultCode ( int32_t  code)

Change the current result code of this broadcast; only works with broadcasts sent through Context::sendOrderedBroadcast.

Often uses the RESULT_CANCELED and RESULT_OK constants, though the actual meaning of this value is ultimately up to the broadcaster.

This method does not work with non-ordered broadcasts such as those sent with Context::sendBroadcast

Parameters:
codeThe new result code.
void gaia::core::Subscriber::setResultData ( gaia::base::String *  data)

Change the current result data of this broadcast; only works with broadcasts sent through Context::sendOrderedBroadcast.

This is an arbitrary string whose interpretation is up to the broadcaster.

This method does not work with non-ordered broadcasts such as those sent with Context::sendBroadcast

Parameters:
dataThe new result data; may be NULL.
void gaia::core::Subscriber::setResultExtras ( Persistence *  extras)

Change the current result extras of this broadcast; only works with broadcasts sent through Context::sendOrderedBroadcast.

This is a Persistence holding arbitrary data, whose interpretation is up to the broadcaster. Can be set to NULL. Calling this method completely replaces the current map (if any).

This method does not work with non-ordered broadcasts such as those sent with Context::sendBroadcast

Parameters:
extrasThe new extra data map; may be NULL.
